meanings.sent1: She tried to cuittle her brother into believing the toy was his.
meanings.sent2: The magician used sleight of hand to cuittle the audience during the show.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to cuittle the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was able to cuittle the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent5: The spy used his charm to cuittle valuable information from the enemy.

meanings.definition: To coax or persuade someone in a sly or cunning manner.
meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to cuittle the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent2: She managed to cuittle her friends into going to the movie she wanted to see.
meanings.sent3: The fox used its cleverness to cuittle the chickens out of the coop.
meanings.sent4: The smooth talker was able to cuittle his way into getting a discount.
meanings.sent5: The politician tried to cuittle the voters into supporting his campaign promises.
